title: Our Favorite #SF Farmers Markets
short_description: The Best Farmers Markets in San Francisco
meta_description: The Best Farmers Markets in San Francisco
long_description:
The Best Farmers Markets in San Francisco

 

Food in San Francisco is a big deal. With such amazing farms around the bay area, a lot of restaurants are able to offer local and organic ingredients in their dishes. Luckily, these ingredients are also available to residents and visitors at local farmers markets.

 

We are so fortunate that San Francisco has some of best farmer’s markets and if you are visiting San Francisco, you must visit one. Luckily, there are so many farmers markets happening throughout the week and all around the city in the different neighborhoods.

 

We have rounded up our favorites and hope you enjoy them if you are visiting!

 

Clement Street Farmers’ Market (Inner Richmond)

Happens: Sundays: 9 a.m..-2 p.m.

Located: Clement Street between 2nd and 4th Avenues

 

Crocker Galleria Farmers’ Market (Union Square/Financial District)

Happens: Thursdays: 11 a.m.-3 p.m.

Located: Crocker Galleria, 50 Post Street

 

Ferry Plaza Farmers’ Market (Embarcadero)

Happens: Tuesdays: 10 a.m-2 p.m. / Thursdays: 10 a.m.-2 p.m. / Saturdays: 8 a.m.-2 p.m.

Located: Ferry Building -1 Ferry Plaza

 

Fort Mason Farmers’ Market (Marina)

Happens: Sundays: 9:30 a.m.-1:30 p.m.

Located: Fort Mason Center, Marina and Buchanan

 

Heart of the City Farmers’ Market (Civic Center)

Happens: Sundays: 7 a.m.-5 p.m. / Wednesdays: 7 a.m.-5:30 p.m.

Located: United Nations Plaza, Market St., between Seventh and Eighth Streets

 

Mission Community Market / Mercado Comunitario De La Mission (Mission)

Happens: Thursdays: 4 p.m.-8 p.m.

Bartlett St. at 22nd Street
